claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling in tumors

evidence.quote: Type I interferon response score (normalized units): 3.1 vs 1.0
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings

claims.claim: Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase, leading to a broader peptide repertoire on MHC-I

evidence.quote: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome: 62.3% vs 37.3%
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome: 40.6% vs 20.6%

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors

claims.claim: PD-L1 pathway activity increases after intratumoral mRNA vaccination, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue: 2.4x vs 1.0x
PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings

claims.claim: Combined mRNA vaccination and checkpoint blockade intervention improves tumor control in mice and is associated with better outcomes in vaccinated patients receiving ICI treatment

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value: p=0.01
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely and tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limit direct causal interpretation

claims.claim: Type I interferon signaling is essential for the sensitization effect, as blocking IFNAR1 eliminates the benefit

evidence.quote: Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors
